JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON Wołąsiewicz , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

GPE , the applicant 's legal predecessor , owned a brickyard located in PERSON . By virtue of a decision issued on DATE the Minister of Light Industry ( Minister PERSON ) nationalised the brickyard pursuant to LAW DATE on ORG .

In DATE PERSON made an application to ORG ( Minister PERSON i GPE ) for annulment of the DATE decision on nationalisation . On DATE the Minister declared the DATE decision null and void . The PERSON municipality appealed against that decision . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed its appeal .

On DATE PERSON requested the Minister of Industry and Commerce to award her compensation for damage sustained as a result of the nationalisation decision . In DATE the Minister ordered PERSON to indicate the actual damage ( szkoda rzeczywista ) sustained in connection with the nationalisation . In DATE PERSON submitted that her compensation claim amounted to MONEY ( PLN ) .
On DATE the Minister awarded PERSON compensation in the amount of ORG .

GPE contested the amount of the award . In DATE she sued ORG before ORG ( Sąd Wojewódzki ) , seeking further compensation in the amount of ORG MONEY . On DATE ORG dismissed her claim . PERSON appealed against that judgment to ORG ( Sąd Apelacyjny ) .
Following PERSON 's death , the applicant and her CARDINAL other successors became parties to the proceedings before ORG .
On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG .

In DATE the applicant and other co - plaintiffs lodged a cassation appeal against the judgment of ORG . They also requested to be exempted from court fees required for proceeding with their cassation appeal . They claimed that due to their difficult financial situation they could not afford to pay them . The applicant stressed that his DATE salary amounted to MONEY . However , he had to support his unemployed wife and his mother - in - law .
On DATE ORG dismissed their application for exemption from court fees . Its decision was not reasoned and no appeal lay against it .

On DATE ORG ordered the applicant and other co - plaintiffs to pay court fees in the amount of PLN CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL . On DATE it rejected their cassation appeal for failure to pay the court fees . The applicant did not appeal against this decision although it would have been open to him to have done so under LAW .

The legal provisions relating to setting court fees as applicable at the material time and questions of practice are set out in paragraphs CARDINAL of the judgment delivered by ORG on DATE in the case of PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL-VI ; see also PERSON and GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) .

Article CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure as applicable at the material time , guarantees a party to proceedings a right to appeal against a decision of the first - instance court which terminates the proceedings . Such an interlocutory appeal ( zażalenie ) is also available against certain decisions , specified in this provision . An appeal is available against a refusal of exemption from court fees when such decision has been given by a firstinstance court . ORG has held in a number of its decisions that no appeal is available against an interlocutory decision on court fees given by a second - instance court . Court fees for lodging such an interlocutory appeal should amount to CARDINAL of the court fee due in the proceedings .

Pursuant to LAW , on the request of a party , a second - instance court shall consider the interlocutory decisions of the first - instance court against which that party could not have filed an interlocutory appeal .

ORG has also held on many occasions that when examining an interlocutory appeal against a decision to reject a cassation appeal for failure to pay court fees , it would also consider the previous decision on refusal to give an exemption from the payment of court fees ( see I ORG CARDINAL/CARDINAL unpublished , I ORG CARDINAL/CARDINAL , OSNC DATE No . CARDINAL , item CARDINAL ) .
